title: 2012 CAF Champions League Final
text:
The 2012 CAF Champions League Final was the final of the <a href="2012%20CAF%20Champions%20League">2012 CAF Champions League</a>, the 48th edition of <a href="Africa">Africa</a>'s premier club <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament organized by the <a href="Confederation%20of%20African%20Football">Confederation of African Football</a> (CAF), and the 16th edition under the current <a href="CAF%20Champions%20League">CAF Champions League</a> format.
The final was played between <a href="Al%20Ahly%20SC">Al-Ahly</a> from <a href="Egyptian%20Football%20Association">Egypt</a> and <a href="Esp%C3%A9rance%20Sportive%20de%20Tunis">Espérance ST</a> from <a href="Tunisian%20Football%20Federation">Tunisia</a>. Al-Ahly won 3–2 on aggregate (first leg: 1–1; second leg: 2–1) to win a record seventh title. As the winner of the 2012 CAF Champions League, they qualified to enter the quarterfinals of the <a href="2012%20FIFA%20Club%20World%20Cup">2012 FIFA Club World Cup</a> as the <a href="Confederation%20of%20African%20Football">CAF</a> representative, as well as participate in the <a href="2013%20CAF%20Super%20Cup">2013 CAF Super Cup</a> against the winner of the <a href="2012%20CAF%20Confederation%20Cup">2012 CAF Confederation Cup</a>.
Qualified teams.
"In the following table, finals until 1996 were in the African Cup of Champions Club era, since 1997 were in the CAF Champions League era."
Venues.
Borg El Arab Stadium Stadium.
<a href="Borg%20El%20Arab%20Stadium">Borg El Arab Stadium</a>, is a <a href="stadium">stadium</a> commissioned in 2005 in the <a href="Mediterranean%20Sea">Mediterranean Sea</a> resort of <a href="Borg%20El%20Arab">Borg El Arab</a>; 25 km west of <a href="Alexandria">Alexandria</a>, <a href="Egypt">Egypt</a>. It is the largest stadium in <a href="Egypt">Egypt</a> and the second largest in <a href="Africa">Africa</a> (after <a href="FNB%20Stadium">FNB Stadium</a> in <a href="Johannesburg">Johannesburg</a>) with a capacity of 86,000 and is an all-seater. It is also the 27th largest stadium in the world, and the <a href="List%20of%20association%20football%20stadiums%20by%20capacity">9th largest association football stadium in the world</a>. It is located on the <a href="Cairo">Cairo</a>-<a href="Alexandria">Alexandria</a> desert highway 10 km from <a href="Borg%20El%20Arab%20Airport">Borg El Arab Airport</a> and 15 km from Alexandria's city center. A running track runs around the pitch, and the ground has four large <a href="Floodlights%20%28sport%29">floodlight</a>s. Only one stand is covered by a roof.
The stadium is 145 <a href="feddans">feddans</a>, is surrounded by a fence which is 3 km long, an internal road network its long is 6 km, a parking lot which could fit 5000 cars and 200 bus beside an airstrip, there are 136 electronic entrances. The main cabin is covered by an umbrella which covers 35% of the stadium total area, and it is considered the biggest umbrella in the Middle East. Its length is 200 m, its dimension is 60 m and its area is 12,000 m2, which is equal to 3 feddans.
The stadium is air-conditioned and that condition includes the clothes chambers, the salons and entrances, also the stadium includes 8 elevators for broadcasters, handicapped, services and important persons. There are 2 sub-stadiums for training and each ground can hold 2000 spectators, includes 2 locker rooms and a stadium for Athletics. The stadium also includes a hotel for 200 guests which is air-conditioned and has a swimming pool, gym and a department building which contains 80 people. The stadium includes a building which contains 300 presses. This building includes cabinets for broadcasters, entrances for emergency, ambulance cars, 39 and cafeterias, 337 bathrooms which classified to 33 bathrooms for women and 8 bathrooms for the handicapped.
Stade Olympique de Radès.
<a href="Stade%20Olympique%20de%20Rad%C3%A8s">Stade Olympique de Radès</a> is a <a href="multi-purpose%20stadium">multi-purpose stadium</a> in <a href="Rad%C3%A8s">Radès</a>, <a href="Tunis">Tunis</a>, <a href="Tunisia">Tunisia</a> about 10 kilometers south-east of the city center of <a href="Tunis">Tunis</a>, in the center of the Olympic City. It is currently used mostly for <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> matches and it also has facilities for athletics. The stadium holds 60,000 and was built in 2001 for the <a href="2001%20Mediterranean%20Games">2001 Mediterranean Games</a> and is considered to be one of the best stadiums in Africa. The stadium was built for the <a href="2001%20Mediterranean%20Games">2001 Mediterranean Games</a>, the 60,000-seat covered area covers 13,000 m2 and consists of a central area, 3 adjoining grounds, 2 warm-up rooms, 2 paintings and an official stand of 7,000 seats. The press gallery is equipped with 300 desks.
<a href="Club%20Africain">Club Africain</a> and <a href="ES%20Tunis">ES Tunis</a> play their major league matches here. Before the construction of this stadium, the <a href="Tunis%20derby">Tunis derby</a> used to be played in the 45,000 seat-capacity <a href="Stade%20El%20Menzah">Stade El Menzah</a>. It is also the stadium of <a href="Tunisia%20national%20football%20team">Tunisia national football team</a> since 2001.
This stadium has hosted matches of the <a href="2004%20African%20Cup%20of%20Nations">2004 African Cup of Nations</a> which was won by the <a href="Tunisia%20national%20football%20team">Tunisian team</a>.
Road to final.
† The match <a href="2012%20CAF%20Champions%20League%20group%20stage%23%C3%89toile%20du%20Sahel%20v%20Esp%C3%A9rance%20ST">Étoile du Sahel v Espérance ST</a> on Matchday 4 was abandoned due to crowd disturbance. The CAF decided to disqualify Étoile du Sahel as a result and all results obtained previously by Étoile du Sahel within Group A were cancelled.
Format.
The final is decided over <a href="two-legged%20tie">two legs</a>, with aggregate goals used to determine the winner. If the sides are level on aggregate after the second leg, the <a href="away%20goals%20rule">away goals rule</a> applied, and if still level, the tie proceed directly to a <a href="penalty%20shootout%20%28association%20football%29">penalty shootout</a> (no <a href="extra%20time%20%28association%20football%29">extra time</a> is played).
